name: Harbour Ville Hotel

reviews.title: What a Great Budget Hotel!
reviews.text: Certainly a budget hotel with open air parking for about 8 cars, 2 elevators servicing 13 rooms per floor, about 10 floors.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: I booked a four day stay with my wife and 2 kids by calling the hotel directly. I did this even if it cost me about US$20/night more than booking through Expedia or the like for 2 reasons: firstly - to verify that there would be no extra charges for 4 of us staying in 1 room (2 twin beds); secondly - to make sure that my reservation was verified and wouldn't get mixed up as some other reviewers claimed.

We got our room on the 8th floor. It had 2 twin beds, a TV, a miniref, a small closet with 3 hangers but no dresser / cabinet. The bathroom was as expected, a bit bigger than usual I guess, but there is no shower divider - just a depression in the corner. They do however give you floor towels now, so no need to use a bath towel on the floor.
reviews.title: Basic hotel, Fair for the price, A little out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it's a clean, comfortable and inexpensive night's stay you're looking for then this hotel is ideal. A $5 SGD cab fare into the city centre, the hotel is quite central and the reception desk is helpful.I cannot fault it for value.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frankly speaking, this is one of the lousiest hotel i've ever stayed in. However, for the price, I supposed I am not in the position to complain. Everything was so basic, the bed was so hard, the blanket was so thin, and any view from the window was non existance. The only plus points I can think of was the bathroom, which was newly renovate. Moreoever, its in the middle of nowhere and you need to take a bus or a taxi to get to the city or the nearest shopping center, Vivocity. I will not recommend this hotel unless you are really tight on budget.
reviews.title: Really Basic

likes.disliked: — Very small and not much ammenities.

reviews.text: Booked this hotel and pre-paid for four nights through Expedia. The furnishing of the room was basic, but both the bedroom and the bathroom were clean. Breakfast is included - don't expect it to be from a first class restaurant, but at least it's hot (as long as you get there before 9:30AM) and not bad for the room rate. It may be slightly out of the way, but several bus routes have stops just steps away from the hotel. On one side of the hotel is a church, and on the other side is the Canadian International School. If you have a room facing the street you will hear heavy duty trucks passing very early in the morning, but that didn't bother us. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Get an E-Link card when you arrive at the airport - even though it has a S$5 non-refundable fee, a substantial discount is given (over single-ticket purchase) on bus and MRT trains.
reviews.title: Great price!
Worth the Price
reviews.text: This hotel is worth the price you pay for. I got a deal for 4 nights for US$200. Only problem is the location. Way out of town. Harbourfront MRT is not walking distance or 1 km. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel. You can take busses from there to the MRT. Takes about five minutes. If you want to connect to the net in your room, you need to borrow a modem from the front desk which is chargeable by the hour. They have about four to six modems. So sometimes, you may not get the modem when you need it. Also the coin operated laundry - people don't bother to take thier clothes out of the machine when its done. It's just left in the machine and you got to wait until the owner collects it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable hotel. Definately worth the price. If I am on a tight budget, I will stay there again.
reviews.title: For the price difficult to fault.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked the hotel, the area was great it was a little ways out of the main city but Chinatown was only 2 mins away by bus one way and a huge mall Vivo City a 10-15 min walk or short bus ride the other way. The rooms were a average to good size, the bed was comfortable and the staff seemed friendly and helpful. We only ate breakfast 2 days we were there. It didn't seem to bad otherwise we tried to eat outside the hotel, try local food. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: agree with the last review

reviews.title: Clean and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - 2 lifts, each with its own button. So if you're on the ground floor, and Lift A is at ground floor, and Lift B is on the 5th floor, and you press the button for lift B, you have to wait for Lift B to come down. Lift A won't open for you even if its already oin the ground floor.
reviews.title: Decent budget accommodation

description: Harbour Ville Hotel in Singapore welcomes business and leisure travelers with our budget-friendly accommodation rates. The hotel, located along Kampong Bahru Road, makes an ideal retreat after a long day of exploring the city. We are situated close to popular landmarks and attractions like the world famous Sentosa, Mount Faber, the newly completed Southern Ridges and Chinatown. For guests on transit to Malaysia or going on cruises, the harbour and bus terminal is a mere 3 minutes drive away.The nine-storey, family-run hotel houses 100 tastefully furnished rooms. We makes sure that every guest gets his money worth with adequate facilities and personalised service.
